turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about AC Sparta Prague.
turn.1: What happened in 1946 with AC Sparta Prague?
turn.2: In 1946, AC Sparta toured Great Britain opening with a 2–2 draw against Arsenal on 2 October.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Golden periods alternated with years when Sparta fans only nostalgically remembered the "good old times".
turn.6: After substantial changes driven by the socialist regime, bringing frequent changes of the club's name rather than achievements to be proud of, the title in 1954 was the last one before a long period of misery.
turn.7: Did they win anything else after that?
turn.8: Only the great era of the team around Andrej Kvašňák in the 1960s brought back memories of the club's golden years.
turn.9: Is there anything else that happened in the 1960s?
turn.10: There are still many people who recollect the era of Andrej Kvašňák, Jiří Tichý and Václav Mašek.
turn.11: What other people recollect that era?
turn.12: Those were the days when Sparta hosted the biggest number of fans in its history, with the stadium at that time accommodating almost 40,000.
